div.class: uk-panel uk-panel-box uk-panel-box-secondary uk-hidden-large uk-hidden-medium uk-margin-top-remove

article.h3: Welcome to the North Judson-San Pierre School Corporation
article.div: Elementary School Principal- Mr. Cary McKay – 574-896-2128
Jr-Sr High School Principal- Mr. James Polite- 574-896-2158

p.style: margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-size: medium; font-family: Cambria; color: #000000;

article.p:
Beginning May 4, North Judson-San Pierre School Corporation will change their current lunch serving program.
The change comes about in order to meet supply and demand as well as offer a different variety of meal.

p.style: margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-size: medium; font-family: Cambria; color: #000000;

article.p:
From May 4 through May 22 all lunches will be served from the Jr-Sr High School front parking lot.
All lunches will be hot lunches. Parents will be permitted to pick up the hot meals without their children present.
However, the students’ ID number must be given in order to meet federal compliance rules.
article.strong:
Because NJ-SP is registered as an “open” site, any child in the community may come, regardless of whether or not they are students in our corporation.
SCHOOL CLOSING INFORMATION due to COVID-19 Virus
eLearning Schedule
Continuous Learning Plan
Meals to Our Students
Lunch Letter
March 16 Letter to Parents
COVID-19 Virus School Closing Information

br.br:
North Judson- San Pierre School Corporation was established in 1965. The corporation is comprised of 138 square miles and encompasses the communities of North Judson and San Pierre. This rural area incudes both Starke County and Pulaski County. These counties are in two different time zones. North Judson is located 40 miles East of Valparaiso, Indiana and 30 miles South of LaPorte, Indiana.
WHAT NJ-SP HAS TO OFFER
Student Centered
High Ability Program Initiatives
Ever- Expanding Vocational Education Programs
18 Advanced Placement/ Dual Credit Courses
Prominent and Recognized FFA Programs
State Championship Acedemic Teams
Agriculture/ Industrial Arts Programs
16 Varsity Level Sports for Men and Women
Superlative Performing Arts Center
Wide Range of Extra Curricular Activities
Title 1 Program Including K-6 RTI
Comprehensive Special Education Programs

div.p: It is the policy of the North Judson-San Pierre School Corporation not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, or disability in its educational programs or employment policies as required by the Indiana Civil Rights Act, Titles VI and VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, the Equal Pay Act of 1973, Title II, Title IX and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973. ” Questions and concerns should be directed to the Title IX, Title II, and Section 504 Coordinator as follows: Dr. Annette Zupin, Superintendent of Schools c/o North Judson-San Pierre Schools 801 Campbell Dr., North Juson, IN 46366 Phone: (574) 896-2155
